when_to_say: Used to express gratitude.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！(arigatou,tetsudattekurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone during the daytime.
example: こんにちは！今日はいい天気ですね。(Konnichiwa! Kyou wa ii tenki desu ne.) - Hello! It's nice weather today.

when_to_say: Used in the morning when greeting someone.
example: おはよう、元気ですか？(Ohayou, genki desu ka?) - Good morning, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。(Sumimasen, michi wo oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, could you please tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree with something.
example: はい、分かりました。(Hai, wakarimashita.) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used to negate or disagree with something.
example: いいえ、違います。(Iie, chigaimasu.) - No, that's not right.

when_to_say: Used to make a polite request.
example: お願いします、このレポートを見てください。(Onegai shimasu, kono repooto wo mite kudasai.) - Please, look at this report.

when_to_say: Used to apologize.
example: ごめんなさい、遅れました。(Gomen nasai, okuremashita.) - I'm sorry, I'm late.

when_to_say: Used when expressing understanding.
example: はい、わかります。(Hai, wakarimasu.) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used in response to 'thank you'.
example: ありがとう！ どういたしまして。(Arigatou! Dou itashimashite.) - Thank you! You're welcome.

when_to_say: Used when going to bed or parting at night.
example: おやすみなさい。(Oyasuminasai.) - Good night.

when_to_say: Used when offering something to someone.
example: どうぞ、お座りください。(Douzo, osuwari kudasai.) - Please, sit down.

when_to_say: Used when handing something over.
example: はい、どうぞ。(Hai, douzo.) - Here you go.

when_to_say: Used to reject something or indicate it's not allowed.
example: それはだめです。(Sore wa dame desu.) - That is not allowed.

when_to_say: Used to express admiration or amazement.
example: すごい！よくできました。(Sugoi! Yoku dekimashita.) - Amazing! Well done.

when_to_say: Used to reassure someone that things are okay.
example: 大丈夫ですか？(Daijoubu desu ka?) - Are you okay?

when_to_say: Used to ask the price of something.
example: これはいくらですか？(Kore wa ikura desu ka?) - How much is this?

when_to_say: Used to ask about something.
example: なにをしていますか？(Nani wo shiteimasu ka?) - What are you doing?

when_to_say: Used to ask about a location.
example: トイレはどこですか？(Toire wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the bathroom?

when_to_say: Used to ask about time.
example: いつ会えますか？(Itsu aemasu ka?) - When can we meet?

when_to_say: Used to refer to a short period of time.
example: しばらくお待ちください。(Shibaraku omachi kudasai.) - Please wait for a while.

meaning: thank you for your hard work
when_to_say: Used to thank someone for their effort, often after work.
example: お疲れ様でした。(Otsukaresama deshita.) - Thank you for your hard work.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone’s well-being.
example: 元気ですか？(Genki desu ka?) - How are you?

when_to_say: Used to describe being busy.
example: 今日はとても忙しいです。(Kyou wa totemo isogashii desu.) - I am very busy today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something enjoyable.
example: 今日は楽しい一日でした。(Kyou wa tanoshii ichinichi deshita.) - Today was a fun day.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather or things.
example: 今日はとても寒いです。(Kyou wa totemo samui desu.) - It is very cold today.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather or things.
example: 今日は暑いですね。(Kyou wa atsui desu ne.) - It's hot today, isn't it?

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is new.
example: 新しい本を買いました。(Atarashii hon wo kaimashita.) - I bought a new book.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is old.
example: この車は古いです。(Kono kuruma wa furui desu.) - This car is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe something large.
example: 大きい家ですね。(Ookii ie desu ne.) - That's a big house.

when_to_say: Used to describe something small.
example: このバッグは小さいです。(Kono baggu wa chiisai desu.) - This bag is small.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is expensive or high in height.
example: この時計は高いです。(Kono tokei wa takai desu.) - This watch is expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is cheap or inexpensive.
example: このレストランは安いです。(Kono resutoran wa yasui desu.) - This restaurant is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe distance.
example: 駅は遠いです。(Eki wa tooi desu.) - The station is far.

when_to_say: Used to describe proximity.
example: 駅は近いです。(Eki wa chikai desu.) - The station is near.

when_to say: Used to refer to the next day.
example: 明日、仕事があります。(Ashita, shigoto ga arimasu.) - I have work tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the previous day.
example: 昨日は忙しかったです。(Kinou wa isogashikatta desu.) - Yesterday was busy.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the current day.
example: 今日は映画を見に行きます。(Kyou wa eiga wo mini ikimasu.) - I am going to watch a movie today.

when_to_say: Used to ask about the time.
example: 何時に会いますか？(Nanji ni aimasu ka?) - What time shall we meet?

when_to_say: Used to refer to the present moment.
example: 今、何をしていますか？(Ima, nani wo shiteimasu ka?) - What are you doing now?

when_to_say: Used to refer to something happening after the present time.
example: 後で電話します。(Atode denwa shimasu.) - I will call you later.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a time earlier than the present.
example: 前に行った場所はどこですか？(Mae ni itta basho wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the place you went before?

when_to_say: Used to describe a busy situation.
example: 今日はとても忙しいです。(Kyou wa totemo isogashii desu.) - Today is very busy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something enjoyable.
example: 今日は楽しい日でした。(Kyou wa tanoshii hi deshita.) - Today was a fun day.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is interesting or amusing.
example: その映画は面白いです。(Sono eiga wa omoshiroi desu.) - That movie is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe a peaceful or quiet environment.
example: この場所は静かです。(Kono basho wa shizuka desu.) - This place is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe something loud or noisy.
example: この部屋はうるさいです。(Kono heya wa urusai desu.) - This room is noisy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is fast or happens early.
example: 電車は早いです。(Densha wa hayai desu.) - The train is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is slow or happens late.
example: バスは遅いです。(Basu wa osoi desu.) - The bus is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is long in length or duration.
example: この道は長いです。(Kono michi wa nagai desu.) - This road is long.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is short in length or duration.
example: この映画は短いです。(Kono eiga wa mijikai desu.) - This movie is short.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is inexpensive.
example: このレストランは安いです。(Kono resutoran wa yasui desu.) - This restaurant is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is expensive.
example: このカメラは高いです。(Kono kamera wa takai desu.) - This camera is expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe something frightening or scary.
example: その映画は怖いです。(Sono eiga wa kowai desu.) - That movie is scary.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is fun or enjoyable.
example: このイベントは楽しいです。(Kono ibento wa tanoshii desu.) - This event is fun.

when_to_say: Used to express dislike.
example: 私はその食べ物が嫌いです。(Watashi wa sono tabemono ga kirai desu.) - I dislike that food.

when_to_say: Used to express like or preference.
example: 私は日本の料理が好きです。(Watashi wa nihon no ryouri ga suki desu.) - I like Japanese food.

when_to_say: Used to express happiness or joy.
example: プレゼントをもらってうれしいです。(Purezento wo moratte ureshii desu.) - I'm happy to receive the present.

when_to_say: Used to express sadness.
example: 彼は悲しそうです。(Kare wa kanashisou desu.) - He looks sad.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty or delicious food.
example: このケーキはおいしいです。(Kono keeki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to express hunger.
example: お腹がすいたので、食べましょう。(Onaka ga suita node, tabemashou.) - I'm hungry, so let's eat.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty or delicious food.
example: このラーメンはおいしいです。(Kono raamen wa oishii desu.) - This ramen is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to reassure someone or say that something is fine.
example: 大丈夫ですよ。(Daijoubu desu yo.) - It's okay.

when_to_say: Used when expressing fear or anxiety.
example: 私はそれを恐れています。(Watashi wa sore wo osoreteimasu.) - I am afraid of that.

when_to_say: Used to express laughter or amusement.
example: 彼は笑っています。(Kare wa waratteimasu.) - He is laughing.

when_to_say: Used to express crying or sadness.
example: 彼女は泣いています。(Kanojo wa naiteimasu.) - She is crying.

when_to_say: Used when offering or asking for help.
example: 私が手伝います。(Watashi ga tetsudaimasu.) - I will help you.

when_to_say: Used when referring to drinking something.
example: 水を飲みます。(Mizu wo nomimasu.) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing.
example: 手紙を書く。(Tegami wo kaku.) - Write a letter.

when_to_say: Used to refer to looking at something.
example: 映画を見る。(Eiga wo miru.) - Watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when listening to something.
example: 音楽を聞く。(Ongaku wo kiku.) - Listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to purchasing something.
example: 本を買う。(Hon wo kau.) - Buy a book.

when_to_say: Used to refer to studying.
example: 日本語を勉強する。(Nihongo wo benkyou suru.) - Study Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to refer to running.
example: 公園で走る。(Kouen de hashiru.) - Run in the park.

when_to_say: Used to refer to walking.
example: 家まで歩く。(Ie made aruku.) - Walk to the house.

when_to_say: Used to refer to talking or speaking.
example: 友達と話す。(Tomodachi to hanasu.) - Talk with friends.

when_to_say: Used when referring to living in a place.
example: 東京に住む。(Tokyo ni sumu.) - Live in Tokyo.

when_to_say: Used to refer to eating.
example: りんごを食べる。(Ringo wo taberu.) - Eat an apple.

when_to_say: Used to refer to opening something.
example: 窓を開ける。(Mado wo akeru.) - Open the window.

when_to_say: Used to refer to closing something.
example: ドアを閉める。(Doa wo shimeru.) - Close the door.
